sub_title: UX Designer, Product Manager, Agile leader
summary:
I humanise technology as a UX designer, Product Manager and Agile leader.
Making technology usable, enjoyable, and accessible for humans.
20 years experience, 10 years in big complex orgs.

I have always been interested in the interaction between humans and technology and the communication around that. I learned early that I was quick in understanding the needs of people and could adapt the technology to make it usable for them and also to tech them how to use it.

This lead me to pursue roles and educations that was catering to this - long before anyone knew what a UX designer was. I have 20 years and have studied IT and communication sciences, usability, interaction design, graphic Design and Web development.

I both have a strong attention to detail and a good overview. I have high ambitions, like challenges, love to learn and evolve. I am pedagogical, analytical, structured, good at making strategic decisions and have good interpersonal and communication skills.

My attitude is always that it is fun and necessary to move forward, improve, develop and learn new things. I am a dynamic, flexible, meticulous and driven person. For me it is easy to learn new things and I understand that the key to success is to be flexible and adapt to new realities with a solid knowledge base to hold on to.

I am based in Leiden, The Netherlands. Relocated from Stockholm, Sweden July 2021.
I like to work hybrid and I can be onsite 1-3 days/week if the office is in the Randstad area (Leiden, Amsterdam, Haarlem, Rotterdam, The Hague, Utrecht and their surrounding areas). If it’s longer away and has reasonable travel time I can be onsite 1-4 times/month depending on traveling time etc.

I speak English and Swedish fluently and I am learning Dutch.

UX Designer
UX lead, Service designer, Process designer, Product designer, UI designer, UX researcher, Domain knowledge, User centered design, Prototyping/Wireframes, Visual design, Impact mapping, In-depth interviews, Target groups/Personas, Workshops, User flows, User stories/mapping, Usability test, Information architecture, Accessibility, Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, Balsamiq

Agile leader
Scrum Master, Process facilitator, Application management lead, Agile processes designer, Feature teams leader, Coordinator, Collaboration, Scrum, Kanban

More info: http://linddesign.nu

profile_positions.title: UX/UI Designer, UI Developer, Agile leader

profile_positions.description:
The Public Health Agency of Sweden has a national responsibility for public health issues and works to ensure good public health.

The project that I was working on was making a new version of a system from scratch that maps and prevents the spread of communicable diseases in the population. It is very complex and has many stakeholders: local health care units, laboratories, regional infection control units and The Public Health Agency of Sweden.


* UX Designer / Requirements Manager *
I was managing all de requirements for the project, it was an extensive catalogue of requirements. I was responsible for creating and organising the requirements
and helping co-workers to find the right place to look for the requirements. I also constructed Issues in Jira with manageable parts of the requirements for development.

The user’s needs, web standards and accessibility is always central in the requirements and when I design or redesign the UI or create copy.

* Product Owner team manager / Scrum Master / Process facilitator *
When I started in the project there was no clear implemented process and no tools to support it. I designed a process with the help of the team in a series of workshops and implemented it in Jira and Confluence. It was an agile process with workgroups and requirements handling in Scrum that we lately changed to mostly Kanban.

I coordinated the POs/business experts and digested their knowledge into requirements. I also had the role of acting PO for the team so they can ask me if they could change requirements during the development. I made decisions based of my knowledge of the domain and usability and when needed gathered input from the other POs.

* User interface developer *
I was also responsible for the development of the UI. I rewrote the code for the UI and made a redesign of the graphical look and implemented frameworks. I have educated my co-workers on how to code for the frameworks and according to my guidelines for this project.

profile_positions.description:
The goal with my work at SMHI was to analyse the navigation on smhi.se and deliver a proposal to improve the navigation without a total redesign. 
- Delivered a report on the current situation and problems
- Gathered the needs of the users
- Designed a structure for the navigation in different levels and screen sizes
- Made graphical design for all types of menus and navigation.
- Gave a list of ideas to improve the site in the future.

SMHI, the Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute, is an expert authority with a global outlook and a vital mission to forecast changes in weather, water and climate. With a scientific foundation, they use knowledge, research and services to contribute to a more sustainable society.
profile_positions.title: UX/UI Designer (via Bouvet)

profile_positions.description:
* Designing a new communicative structure *
The municipality hade a new website and I was tasked with designing a new communicative structure for different types of pages. I designed and built graphical elements that could be used to describe different types of content. The conclusion of this was a style guide that describes the different components and how to use them to communicate.

* Waste and recycling sub site *
I designed a new structure for this part of the site that was task-focused and based on the citizens needs and goals. The goal was to make it possible for the users to find the solution and do the task themselves rather than having to contact someone and wait. Sketches with high fidelity was used as an important tool to deliver the vision of the new structure.

I was lead UI developer on a big project to develop a new pedagogical system to support teacher students, there supervisors and the teachers during there internship which are a big part of there education. The system is used by 7 universities and all of Stockholm’s municipalities.

For the external webb I worked as application management lead and product owner to facilitate the process between the communication department and the IT department.

I developed a Angular/javascript based printsevice for the students. It was connected to a service and the printers via a REST-API.

I had a Union assignment on University level and was chairman for the local branch at the IT department.
